content.metaTitle: Living in Orihuela Costa | Golf Properties Costa Blanca South
content.metaDescription: Complete guide to living in Orihuela Costa. Golf properties, beaches, La Zenia Boulevard, expat community. New build homes from €195,000.
content.heroIntro:
Orihuela Costa is the premier golf and lifestyle destination on Costa Blanca South, stretching along 16 kilometers of Mediterranean coastline from Punta Prima to Campoamor. This purpose-built resort area combines world-class golf courses, pristine beaches, and Europe's largest open-air shopping center with modern residential communities.

What sets Orihuela Costa apart is its perfect balance of resort amenities and authentic Spanish living. While urbanizations like Villamartin, La Zenia, and Cabo Roig cater to an international community, the historic city of Orihuela—a cathedral city with centuries of history—lies just 25 minutes inland, offering cultural depth alongside coastal convenience.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in Orihuela Costa revolves around outdoor living. With six championship golf courses within 15 minutes, 16 kilometers of beaches, and over 320 sunny days per year, this is a destination built for those who want to make the most of the Mediterranean climate.

The area has one of Spain's largest established expat communities, particularly around Villamartin and La Zenia. English is widely spoken, international clubs and societies abound, and integrating into the community is effortless.
highlights: La Zenia Boulevard—Europe's largest open-air shopping center
Established international community with clubs and societies
Excellent value new builds compared to Costa Blanca North
Year-round outdoor lifestyle with 320+ sunny days
Choice of vibrant resort areas or quieter urbanizations

amenitiesSection.beaches: Orihuela Costa's 16 kilometers of coastline includes Blue Flag beaches at La Zenia, Playa Flamenca, Cabo Roig, and Campoamor. Each has excellent facilities including beach bars, restaurants, showers, and accessibility features. The beaches feature fine golden sand and calm waters, perfect for families.
amenitiesSection.dining: From traditional Spanish restaurants in Cabo Roig's harbor to international cuisine at La Zenia Boulevard, dining options are endless. The Villamartin Plaza is famous for its restaurant scene and lively atmosphere. Fresh seafood abounds—try the local arroz caldero or grilled prawns.
amenitiesSection.shopping: La Zenia Boulevard is the crown jewel—over 150 stores including Primark, H&M, Zara, Media Markt, plus supermarkets, cinemas, and dozens of restaurants. It's one of Europe's largest open-air shopping centers. Smaller commercial centers in each urbanization provide daily essentials.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital Universitario de Torrevieja is just 10 km away, with comprehensive services and English-speaking staff. Multiple private medical centers, dental clinics, and 24-hour pharmacies serve the area. The large international community means healthcare services are well-adapted to foreign patients.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante Airport is 55 km (40 minutes via AP-7 motorway). Murcia-Corvera Airport is 35 km (30 minutes). The area is well-connected by road, though a car is recommended for daily life. Local buses connect the main urbanizations.

content.propertyMarketSection:
Orihuela Costa offers exceptional choice in property types and price points. New build apartments start from around €195,000-250,000, townhouses from €250,000-350,000, and villas from €400,000-750,000. This represents outstanding value compared to Costa Blanca North.

The area continues to see strong development activity, with quality builders like Taylor Wimpey and local developers delivering modern, well-specified homes. Golf-adjacent properties command premium prices but offer excellent rental potential.

Investment returns are strong—the combination of golf tourism, beach access, and shopping attracts visitors year-round. Properties with pools, golf views, or walking distance to La Zenia Boulevard achieve the highest rental yields.
whyLiveHereSection: Unrivaled golf access—6 courses within 15 minutes
La Zenia Boulevard shopping on your doorstep
Easy access to two international airports

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa good for golf?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is the best golf destination on Costa Blanca South. Six championship courses are within 15 minutes, including the famous Villamartin, Las Colinas (consistently ranked among Spain's best), and Campoamor. The year-round playing season and excellent facilities attract golfers from across Europe.

faqs.question: What is La Zenia Boulevard?
faqs.answer: La Zenia Boulevard is one of Europe's largest open-air shopping centers, located in the heart of Orihuela Costa. It features over 150 stores including major brands like Primark, Zara, and Media Markt, plus supermarkets, cinemas, restaurants, and entertainment. It's a major attraction for both residents and visitors.

faqs.question: How far is Orihuela Costa from Alicante Airport?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is approximately 55 km from Orihuela Costa, taking around 40 minutes via the AP-7 motorway. Murcia-Corvera Airport is closer at 35 km (30 minutes), offering additional flight options, particularly with Ryanair.

faqs.question: What are the best areas to buy in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Popular areas include Villamartin for golf lifestyle and established community, La Zenia for beach and shopping access, Cabo Roig for its charming harbor and beaches, Playa Flamenca for family-friendly environment, and Campoamor for a quieter, more upscale atmosphere. Each offers different character and price points.

faqs.question: Is English widely spoken in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Yes, English is very widely spoken throughout Orihuela Costa due to the large British and international community. Most shops, restaurants, healthcare providers, and services cater to English speakers. Many businesses are actually British-owned.

faqs.question: What are property prices like in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: New build apartments start from around €195,000, townhouses from €250,000, and villas from €400,000. Golf properties and those near La Zenia Boulevard command premium prices. Overall, Orihuela Costa offers excellent value compared to Costa Blanca North.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa suitable for year-round living?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orihuela Costa is excellent for year-round living. Unlike some seasonal resort areas, it has a large permanent resident population with full services operating year-round. Winters are mild (average 16-18°C), and the area maintains a vibrant atmosphere throughout the year.

faqs.question: What is the rental market like in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa has a strong rental market driven by golf tourism, beach holidays, and shopping visitors to La Zenia Boulevard. Properties achieve good occupancy year-round, with peak demand during golf season (spring and autumn) and summer holidays. Golf-view and beach-proximity properties perform best.

faqs.question: Are there good healthcare facilities near Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Torrevieja's modern university hospital is just 10 km away, with comprehensive services including emergency care and English-speaking staff. Multiple private clinics, dental practices, and 24-hour pharmacies serve the area. Healthcare quality is excellent.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Villamartin, La Zenia, and Cabo Roig?
faqs.answer: Villamartin centers around the golf course with established expat community and famous plaza. La Zenia is the commercial heart near the beach and Boulevard shopping. Cabo Roig has a charming harbor, rocky coves, and Saturday market with a more traditional feel. Each attracts different buyer profiles.
